relation: Enters Ethernet storage mode for the specified fabric.
Enters Ethernet storage port channel mode.
Enables or disables the administrative state of the port channel. The port channel is disabled by default.
Commits the transaction to the system configuration.
pageTitle: System Configuration - Configuring Ports  [Cisco UCS Manager] - Cisco Systems

textBeforeTable: Procedure You can only configure server ports on the fixed port module. Expansion modules do not include server ports. Configuring a Server Port Server Ports You can only configure uplink Fibre Channel ports on an expansion module. The fixed module does not include uplink Fibre Channel ports. By default, Fibre Channel ports are uplink. However, you can configure them to function as Fibre Channel storage ports. This is useful in cases where a Cisco UCS requires a connection to a Direct-Attached Storage (DAS) device. Uplink Fibre Channel ports handle FCoE traffic between the fabric interconnect and the next layer of the network. All network-bound FCoE traffic is pinned to one of these ports. Uplink Fibre Channel Ports You can configure uplink Ethernet ports on either the fixed module or an expansion module. Appliance FCoE Uplink Server By default, Ethernet ports are unconfigured. However, you can configure them to function in the following ways: Uplink Ethernet ports handle Ethernet traffic between the fabric interconnect
textAfterTable: UCS-A# scope eth-server UCS-A /eth-server # scope fabric b UCS-A /eth-server/fabric # create interface 1 12 UCS-A /eth-server/fabric* # commit-buffer UCS-A /eth-server/fabric # Unconfiguring a Server Port Procedure   Command or Action Purpose Step 1 UCS-A# scope eth-server   Enters Ethernet server mode.   Step 2 UCS-A /eth-server # scope fabric {a | b}   Enters Ethernet server fabric mode for the specified fabric.   Step 3 UCS-A /eth-server/fabric # delete interface slot-num port-num   Deletes the interface for the specified Ethernet server port.   Step 4 UCS-A /eth-server/fabric # commit-buffer   Commits the transaction to the system configuration.   The following example unconfigures Ethernet server port 12 on slot 1 of fabric B and commits the transaction:
